title: Italy’s Giorgia Meloni Condemns Russia and Pledges Further Support to Ukraine
description: The prime minister, Giorgia Meloni, reiterated her backing amid dissension within her coalition government on the issue.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Biden and Putin Speak on Ukraine
description: Also, Saudi Arabia intensifies a crackdown and the Philippines moves closer to the U.S.

title: Judge Rejects Bid by Sept. 11 Families to Seize Frozen Afghan Central Bank Funds
description: A lawyer for the lead group of victims’ relatives who had sought $3.5 billion to pay off the Taliban’s judgment debts said they would appeal.

title: Mexico’s Ex-Top Security Official Is Convicted of Cartel Bribery
description: A Brooklyn jury found Genaro García Luna guilty of taking millions of dollars from the Sinaloa drug cartel when he was in charge of Mexico’s bloody war on organized crime.

title: Mpox Often Leads to Severe Illness, Even Death, in People With Advanced H.I.V.
description: The death rate among these patients is about 15 percent, researchers reported. The virus should be added to the list of opportunistic infections seen in patients with advanced H.I.V., scientists said.

title: Israel Unlikely to Extradite Mexico’s Ex-Official Wanted Over Missing Students
description: The Mexican authorities say Tomás Zerón tortured witnesses and tampered with evidence in a crucial investigation into the 2014 disappearance of 43 students.

title: Poland’s Prime Minister Says His Country Was Right About Russia
description: ‘We are being listened to more and more on what is going on around us,” Poland’s prime minister said in an interview.

title: China’s Courtship of European Powers Hits a Russian Wall
description: Beijing, in urgent need of reviving its economy, wants to mend ties with Europe but is struggling to create distance between itself and Moscow.

title: Parched California Misses a Chance to Store More Rain Underground
description: Torrential rains could have helped to replenish depleted aquifers, but some say state bureaucracy, designed to distribute water fairly, has stood in the way.

title: China’s Leading Electric Carmaker Has Arrived in Germany
description: BYD is a powerhouse in China and sells the most electric vehicles of any company in the world. Now it has a plan to attract buyers in Europe’s largest economy.

title: Wagner Group Chief Accuses Russian Military Command of Treason
description: The mercenary group’s founder, Yevgeny Prigozhin, operated for years in secrecy, but he has assumed an increasingly public role in the Ukraine conflict since last summer.

title: What Putin’s Suspension of New START Treaty Means for Arms Control
description: Mutual inspections have been suspended for years because of the pandemic. But New START, the last nuclear agreement between Russia and the United States, is dying.

title: 1923: Blaze Destroys Army Buildings
description: The fire gutted orderly rooms and stores of the Fifth Division.

title: After Another Earthquake, Turkey Rescue Workers Push On
description: In the third week of a grueling effort, emergency workers battle exhaustion as the hope of finding more earthquake survivors dwindles. A powerful new quake has complicated their task.

title: A Sudden Rush to Make Sustainable Aviation Fuel Mainstream
description: United Airlines and other companies have started a $100 million fund to invest in jet fuel that produces fewer greenhouse gases.

title: Lives We Can Save
description: The opioid crisis doesn’t need to be this bad. It’s another example of America’s surprising resistance to effective treatments

title: Live Updates: Putin Pulls Back From Nuclear Arms Treaty, Signaling Sharper Break With West
description: Vladimir V. Putin said Russia would suspend its participation in New START, its last remaining nuclear arms control agreement with the United States, and gave no indication that he would end his invasion of Ukraine. President Biden is scheduled to speak a few hours from now in Poland.

title: In Northern Ukraine, a Different Sort of War Game
description: Russian forces are shelling border areas there to tie up thousands of Ukrainian troops that might otherwise defend against attacks farther south.

title: ‘Equality of Injustice for All’: Saudi Arabia Expands Crackdown on Dissent
description: The kingdom’s courts are meting out harsher punishments than ever to citizens who criticize the government, with prosecutions built on Twitter posts ending in prison sentences of 15 to 45 years.

title: Ridge Alkonis Prison Sentence Strains U.S.-Japan Relations
description: Lt. Ridge Alkonis was sentenced to three years after causing a deadly traffic accident in 2021. The case has irritated U.S. relations with a crucial military ally.

title: Are North Korea’s Nuclear Weapons Tests as Safe as the Country Claims?
description: The country has conducted six underground nuclear tests, and a seventh may be on the way. Rights groups fear their environmental and health consequences.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: President Biden’s covert trip to Kyiv.

title: Inside Biden’s Surreal and Secretive Journey to Ukraine
description: President Biden traveled covertly to the besieged Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, hoping to demonstrate American resolve to help defeat the Russian forces that invaded a year ago this week.
